name: G-Ball
description: G-Ball is a new sports game set in orbit of Mars in the not-so-distant future. Astronaut athletes challenge you in a mash-up of basketball, football, and dodgeball as you soar through a zero gravity arena in 3 on 3 team matches.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 2000 Processor: Pentium 3 Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 64 MB ATI Radeon/Nvidia GeForce 4 DirectX: Version 9.0b Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: Windows Compatible Sound Card

reviews.review_text: In space, no one can hear you yawn.

This is the worst game I have ver played. Awful Controls. Atrocious Graphics. Barf-Inducing Camera. ♥♥♥♥♥♥ Matchmaking. All bundled up in a nice little diharrea bow. -1212324324524565463455764685643543/10
I'm a little embarrased about what just happened 0/10
Why do I own this? I tried G-Ball for 10 minutes and stopped. Why? Because it feels like unfinished project. The controls are awful, it's multiplayer game only and no one is playing it. Just skip it.

Bad controls of movement and camera are enough to cause nausea. Character moves like a giraffe in zero-g which isn't exactly sporty. Then there are bunch of nonsensical rules which seem to be to make sports fans feel at home or something..  My suggestion: remove all distracting floating things, don't try to make it like 'quidditch in space'. Seems like original idea was about zero-g basketball so make it that: just two goals, a ball and two teams.  That's it.  Now it is just a waste of time as a game, as an experiment and as a simulation since it is entirely hypothetical in nature. If people are going to be playing games in space for excercise it should be kept simple.

I'd say this is more of an early-alpha, not a beta. The game has terrible physics, awkward controls and a nearly-barren playerbase. Needless to say, this was  not  something I waited four months to see.
